result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J Stier was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court will allow for early termination of probation at any point after 6 months if the Agent deems appropriate and a weapons class has been completed.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.  Court waives DNA surcharge and sample.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Defendant to complete a concealed carry class, hunter safety class or a weapons/firearms class.
No use or possession of controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No contact with Lisa S. and Steve S. unless they allow for the contact then the contact is to be non-violent contact.
Defendant to contact Probation by 09:00 a.m. on 12-12-2016.
Court orders the weapon seized to be forfeited and destroyed pursuant to statute by the holding law enforcement agency.

records.addlTxt: Cover letter dated 12/12/16 filed by Atty Bricco filing notice of intent to pursue postconviction relief.
Received and filed in court by the state.

Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Michael J Stier in court with attorney Katie B. Bricco.

State presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defense presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defendant's brother presented a statement to the court.


Court orders the following:
 SENTENCE WITHHELD.

Term of Probation:  9 Months.
Court will allow for early termination at any point after 6 months if agent deems appropriate and a weapons class has been completed.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:   
Defendant to complete a Concealed Carry Class, Hunter Safety Class or a Weapons/Firearms Class.
No Use or Possession of a controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
No contact with:  Lisa S. and Steve S. unless they allow for the contact then the contact is to be non-violent contact.
Defendant to contact probation by 9 am on Monday 12/12/16.

Court orders the weapon seized to be forfeited and destroyed pursuant to statute by the holding law enforcement agency.

Costs:  $243
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  Court Waives.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.
